metadata.dc:author: Maluenda, F
Medina, E
Csendes, A
Becerra, M
Morales, E
Smok, G
metadata.dc:description: The prevalence of gallbladder cancer in 10,468 cholecystectomy patients was studied: 3.4% of the female and only 1.32% of the male population had gallbladder cancer (p < 0.001). The female population had 2.7 times more cholelithiasis, and 7.9 times more cancer than the male population. Cancer incidence increases progressively with age, specially after the 5th decade.
metadata.dc:title: Prevalencia del cáncer de la vesícula biliar en colecistectomías.
[Prevalence of gallbladder neoplasms in cholecystectomies].
